caption: Amazing food and even better service.
Restuarant and food is too good.
persian food and service at this location is excellent. I'll return with my coworkers. Prices are appropriate. Atmosphere is like a restaurant in Fort Worth I loved.

AMAZING PLACE & FOOD & FAMILY-RUN!!!!  So rare to have International A-Players in the US, let alone Chicago ... We're lucky here in Chicago as there are very few Persians here ... A few dozen more of these High Quality Players - and Chicago can approach Manhattan and Beverly Hills ... THXXXX!!!!
Lovely people, lovely Persian food. The ghormeh sabzi is delicious. Excellent seafood as well.
Nice persian food around Chicago area came here second time love the sultani kabab
Persian food here - super tasty. do yourself a favor and give this place a try. the service was very helpful and observant. the place has a cool feel to it.
My preferred place for quality persian food. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. Bring your hunger - portions are filling. They have so many great reviews for a reason.
Persian food at this spot - super good. Looking forward to coming back with my relatives. The prices are well within reason for the quality.
Persian food and service here is better than most. great spot for an appetite of any size. the bill was fair i would say. if it wasn't far from my work i would come by more.
My top location for delicious persian food. super delicious. the staff was helpful and kind. bring your appetite because portions are generous. not so close to my office, unfortunately.
persian food and the setting here is better than most. i love it here. i had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. the place has a good feel to it.
Fine spot for tasty persian food. i will be back with my friends.

Caspian is delicious! The food is amazing and the staff is so kind. I highly recommend the baba ghanoush, mosto mosir, ghormeh sabzi and tahdig. Their Persian tea is also amazing and very authentic. The owner is the nicest man. Best Persian food in the city!
Amazing stuff, great food Highly recommend meal called  DIZZi
Great place and great food seriously reasonable prices I highly recommend it

A fav location for quality persian food. visited fri evening i think. certainly worth a return visit. bring your appetite because portions are generous. menu is similar to a restaurant in jacksonville i loved.

Amazing place to get Persian food! Everything I had was very, very tasty (beef, rice, salad, etc). The owners are very friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be making this one of my regular go-to spots

persian food and the scene at this place is super good. Great place to chill, get away, eat some good food. The service was friendly and observant. Prices are decent. This place has many good reviews for a reason.

My preferred scene for Persian food. i should have took a photo of the food but it was too good to interrupt. definitely worth going back to. bring your hunger - portions are generous. feeling here is similar to a place in columbus i liked.
persian food... super yummy. Looking forward to going back again. I can see why they have a lot of great reviews.
Good site for Persian food. I love this place so much. There was quick, helpful, and friendly service. Prices that are reasonable.
persian food, excellent. kinda of like a cafe in phoenix that i enjoyed.

This was by far the best meal I have had hands down during quarantine and I will definitely be coming back! From the service to the presentation it was 5 seas. I highly recommend that you try this place you will absolutely not be disappointed.
Zereshk polo with chicken is to die for especially since it comes with the red sauce to make it juicy and tasty! Absolutely phenomenal. Must try.
Great food!
First time trying it. The beef kobedeh was very dry. The soup ( ash) was tasteless. Forgot to give the cheese and greens. Wasn’t too impressed.

I highly recommend Caspian. I've been going to this family-owned restaurant for years and am always impressed with their friendly staff, cozy ambience, and the best Persian food in Chicago. The owner gives the best recommendations, but their happy hummus and Persian ice cream is a must.

I am so thankful for technology where we can still get quality food delivered to our door!!  This restaurant is so awesome though inside be sure to check it out (especially if you looking for something "calm").  There are tapestries and all types of interesting culture adorning the walls including - a fountain!  right in the middle of the dining area (I wish I could hear it now).  But back to the food which is most important here if you cooped up inside and tired of using the microwave!  We LOVE the homemade Hummus (and I hate store bought and never eat that stuff) and the rice has a very good flavor along with all the kabobs Ive eaten there.  A while back I tried a hamburger and it was better than most any other.  It's not the best location to find a parking spot, but so worth it and now you don't have to dine in.  The worse part about this though is you will likely not order the homemade Persian ice cream that is delish (and my young daughter loves it too).  BE SURE to try it because we REALLY need to support our local restaurants and when it's "all clear" - RUN to the Caspian for professionally prepared quality food at a price you can afford.  You literally have to take a one day expensive trip to the Persian region to experience this authentic food.  And I can say it because I learned it after practically eating there every day when I worked close by.  Prior to that I never experienced that type of food so let my luck be yours!  Keep them going strong as this a high quality kitchen experience.  Stay strong and see you when the dining room opens again!

I highly recommend this restaurant, great flavorful food, good ambience,  reasonable prices!  Natalie and everyone there gives great recommendations of what ever you may have a taste for. Hidden little gem! We like that it is family owned. A new favorite!

Delicious food, spotless place, wonderful host!! We had an amazing meal: lamb shank, soltani, zereshk polo Morgh:) large portions for sure!! Victoria is a great cook! She explained the menu patiently and created an enjoyable environment! Great reasonable price for what it's been given! We found this place in yelp while driving from Pittsburg to Chicago! Totally got lucky- highly recommend this lovely place!
We had the dizi and loved it! Traditional design and music make the experience even better.

Delicious and authentic. It is family owned and very low key off the beaten path between wicker and bucktown. The ambiance is warm and inviting. Great service and originality. One of a kind experience. Halal meat traditions. A definite stop of a hidden gem.

The staff was friendly, and the food was very mediocre. They describe themselves as vegetarian, but don't have very many options. The service was very slow. I ordered a sangria, and it came as wine with a bunch of maraschino cherries in it.

I watched check please, it was awesome because i go to Caspian Kabab for  the last 2 years and was always happy with the service, food and prices.  I did not see at any time on the check please recording that the owner did not wash his hands! I watched him grilling a fish for 10 seconds maybe! If you don’t have something kind to say then don’t say anything, and certainly not lies.  My friends and I go there all the time, the owner welcomes each and every customer, he tells us that we are his guests! That’s the way it should be.  The food is delicious - Lamb Shank, or the Salmon,  desserts are yummy specially the Saffron ice cream!  Go there and see for yourself!
After watching check please, owner of restaurant didn't wash his hands after touching the meat, was going to go there not NOW, hands not clean, sorry.

This place at best is just ok. I mean you can't call yourself "Fine Persian Cuisine" and serve mediocre Persian food. I have tried Persian food in almost every restaurant around Chicago, and Caspian will not see me again. They have a cozy place, which could be a destination for many. Unfortunately the food I received was tasteless, just like some other comments have mentioned. The chicken was a bit tough and in my opinion it was not fresh. Hummus tasted ok but it was also old. Koobideh taste was nothing special, so overall giving them 3 stars would be very generous. I hope they do better, and if I see some good reviews I'll be back.

I am Persian and grew up eating Persian food so I know how I like my food. I enjoyed the ice cream and the nice relaxing atmosphere but I am sorry... the kabob kubideh was burnt and dry however, the rice was perfect. Kabob Kubideh in my opinion should be the most perfected dish in any Persian restaurant. Staff was kind.
Nice decoration, good music, and great Persian cuisine. I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

This place was awesome. Astonishing interior design and authentic Persian food. I order dizi and Ash. I have  not tasted the ash yet but Dizi was great. They also give cheese and herb as starter and at least they gave me tea which was awesome with thos cube sugars. So Persian. The owner was super friendly and have me a hand for smashing the dizi. For all Iranian s this is the only place to get dizi in Chicago so don't miss it, for every body else I suggest trying it once. It's a unique food that is fun to prepare and eat. Overall I can give even more than 5 star.

What a warm friendly place, family run,  clean nice cozy warm atmosphere. We felt like we were guest in there home. There was 5 of us. We had mixed appitizer's, entrees and deserts. All was prepared fresh and delicious. We talked about the special care they take in quality ingredients as well as preparation. There tea is a homemade blend of 3 herbs and they make there own ice cream, yum yum save room for deserts we had 4 types they were all yummy. We will be back, thanks for making our dinner so enjoyable.
Delicious kabab. Really good baba ghanoush and falafel too. Love the decor.
Great food and service

THE BEST PERSIAN FOOD IN CHICAGO!!!  I eat here every week ! This is by far the BEST Persian food in Chicago.  I tried many Persian restaurants in Chicago and this place is the best Persian food . The food is spectacular and healthy.  The staff is very friendly and the service is spectacular .  I LOVE THIS PLACE !!
The kebab was unedible and had to return it. Never had such bad food in any restaurant, anywhere.
Such an amazing experience! Couldn’t find anything I didn’t like. I will definitely be going back! If you want more authentic food you’ll need to book an international flight.
Talk about a diamond in the rough.  Amazing, authentic Persian food. Never had it? Well you need to. Dizi and kabobs. You’re welcome.
Awesome food, nice traditional decoration and very friendly staff! Wonderful experience I had! Highly recommended!
Don't go.
How old was the Chicken koobideh that you guys sent me ?

Ordered food thru DoorDash from here. The dill rice seemed fresh and was good, but OMG both the chicken kabob and beef kabob skewers were the worst ever!!! They were dry and tasteless! I have absolutely no doubt, they were not fresh. They were precooked and frozen perhaps got warmed up in the microwave. It was even worse than the existing frozen Persian food in the market. This representation of Persian food is not but a disgrace!!! So disappointing!!!! I'm a Persian, I was raised eating these type of food, I cook myself, and I have had these in Persian restaurants all over the world including the multiple other ones in Chicago area. I know what I'm talking about!!! I cannot emphasize how disgusting the food from this restaurant was tonight (9/7/19).

I have been going to Caspian for two years now, I have never been disappointed.  The marinated grilled Salmon is moist and tasty, my favorite is the lamb shank cooked in a light tomato sauce with some carrots and green beans.  I take my friends and coworkers there, we were never disappointed, the owner is so attentive and welcoming.  Definitely my favorite Persian restaurant!
Awesome food! Love the chicken kabob and Steigl on draft!!!!!
The beer was not great, decent prices, not busy.
Food was quite bland, and due to technical error had to wait 45 to be able to pay for the check. Overall bad experience.
Not the best Persian food compared to other Persian restaurants.  I suggest going to kabobi instead.
It was close even though the sign on the door said that they were going to be open
Went here tonight with my boyfriend - great service and amazing food. Tastes very fresh and authentic. Will come again! Great prices too :)
Great authentic Persian food.
Authentic food. Very delicious and great service.
Best kabob I have had outside of Tehran.  Great atmosphere too. $3.5 draft beers for happy hour is unreal deal. Family owned operated.
Very warm atmosphere and service done with a smile! Food was delicious very well prepared.
Great food and awsome service
Absolutely the DIZI is fantastic.
The food was above and beyond our expectations! Their Dizi and Khoreshte Bademjan were so delicious. If you’re craving a real Persian cuisine, give Caspian Kabab a shot. You will not be disappointed!
Great food,  service. Lamb shank was perfect along with the mixed kebab
Disappointed in the food. we must have been there on an off day! the owner is very friendly, the staff is very helpful. we will have to return again so we can change our minds?
(Translated by Google) cool  (Original) legal

Incredible hospitality and delicious food! Misha is knowledgable and passionate about her family food heritage and was excited to show us the ropes. Masoud gave our table a visit and is also very kind. Really great place to explore traditional Persian food. They have a new fountain! The atmosphere is delightful and comfortable. I really felt like we were welcomed into their home and taken well care of. EAT THE ICE CREAM!

One of the best meals of my life! A family-owned restaurant, Meesha will tell you about the best dishes to get and Massud will make them all for you! Their service was absolutely beyond what I had ever experienced, like walking into a friend’s kitchen. My friend and I had not had Persian food before but we tried ghormeh sabzi, kuku sabzi, dizi, Persian salad, and mast-o khiar and it was INCREDIBLE! Also you GOTTA have some Persian ice cream. Like this was some of the best food in Chicago incredible. I’m so grateful I got to experience this wonderful meal, and I will go back again and again!
Great food and service, very personable owner.
Delicious Persian food. Friendly and efficient service.
Food was  great. The bread tah-deeg was exceptionally good.
Persian food here - delicious. The place has a good feel to it.
The home made ice cream is amazing ! Their appetizers are great too.The main course were alright.
Great gluten free and vegetarian options. Try the Persian ice cream, it's a bouquet of flavors.
A warm, cozy atmosphere with a lot of beautiful decorations including a fountain. The server was friendly. The food was delicious.

I visited this pace for the first time last weekend. I ordered Dizi and my husband ordered Barg kabob. Those were the best among what I have ever had till now. Besides the owner was very nice and friendly. I highly recommend this place. you won't regret that! Absolutely 5 Stars
Fine place for tasty Persian food. i love eating here. will surely make a return trip. prices were average for the menu. reminds me of a place in new york i loved to visit.
We went here for nourooz. Service was exceptional. The food was authentic and delicious. The ICE CREAM was our favorite. This place is super underrated. Definitely coming back
Food was dry. The kabob sandwich was just meat and pita and onion. No hummus, no kind of sauce. Fries were good though.
I love there food they have grate service and delicious food I highly recommend this place
Nice place for taste meal
Of the few Persian restaurants I tried in Chicago, this is the best. The owner is very nice and pleasant to talk to. Their icecream is phenomenal
Nice place with unique food. Dizi is highly recommend in this place.
Perfect restaurant,nice people,..
Friendly service, food is always good.
Extremely delicious. High quality and quantity foods. Great staff.
Delicious and super juicy meat.
All the dishes are great! Especially Barg and Koonideh.
The best
One of my fav stops in Chicago

A unique and quaint shop that is easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. The food was actually quite good and the staff was very friendly and happy to serve us. They have a dish here that seems to be their specialty. It's some sort of braised lamb shank that they mix with a sauce and some vegetables in a special clay jar table side. The whole process adds to the experience and the owner was very proud to serve us this dish. It was very good. Served with some flat bread or rice. The pickled vegetables eaten with it really cut through the heaviness of the meat and brought out all the flavors and spices. Service was a tad slow, but that is normal for a place that isn't super busy. We also had a large table and there probably was only one cook, so it's understandable. (I'm a cook myself). Overall would recommend this place. The people are very nice and the food was good and reasonably priced
I have many pleasant experiences with friend and family at Caspian. Give yourself extra time be patient and enjoy the moments with your company  while waiting for your food.
Great place to eat
The kebab was so hard, I could neither cut or chew .. friendly staff and lovely ambience though
Excellent food. Wonderful service!  Great flavors. Great value
They were understaffed when we visited and the food took very long. The food was good, but not worth the wait.
Ty guys for an amazing service with a friendly attitude especially Meesha, the owner is native Persian👍
Great food love the chicken kabob.
Good kebabs, and a very friendly owner that made us feel welcome
First time visit.  Service was very good,  friendly and helpful.  Food was good,  they recommended something and it was good.
Great vibe. Iranian music plays in the background. Lovely and attending staff. Fair prices. Delicious food! Try the icecream!
If you are in Chicago and you didn’t eat here that is mean you miss a lot

Hidden gem for sure. Get one of the traditional Iranian plates. They make the pistachio ice cream daily, and unless you have a medical reason, you absolutely need to order it. Lovely service and ownership as well - friendly and helpful with the traditional meals.
They have authentic Persian food, friendly staff and great ice creams

Great Persian food in a clean, quiet, and cozy restaurant. The service was fast, and the staff was very friendly. A few of their seats were slightly uncomfortable, but everything else was great. The food portions were also generous for their quality and price. I just loved this place, and I'm definitely eating here again.
Pictured here: Persian hummus, and the dizi that comes with a special exibit by the owner - he'll show you how to eat it, and they taste fantastic :)

Would have really liked this place to be good but unfortunately wasn’t close . Tried 3 different kebabs and a lamb shank. Kebobs were all dry from being over cooked and burnt. Lamb shank was decent and held its own. Server was ok and owner seemed to care, just food didn’t hit the mark.

(Translated by Google) The service is excellent, the taste is very delicious, and the price is reasonable.  Mr. Masoud, the owner of the restaurant, we sincerely thank him. As he was very interested in the problem that we faced when parking in one of the big stores (Lewis), where we pulled our car out from there and took us by his own car to the reservation parking, which is half an hour from the restaurant. . . The service is a great, Food is the delicious, price is very reasonable I highly recommend it, and i will comeback again for sure.  (Original) الخدمة ممتازة و الطعم لذيذة جداً و السعر معقول .  الأستاذ مسعود صاحب المطعم نكن له كل الشكر والتقدير ؛ حيث انه كان مهتم جداً للمشكلة التي واجهنا عند الوقوف في احد مواقف المحلات الكبير (لويس) حيث سحبت سيارتنا من هناك واخذنا بسيارته الخاصة إلى موقف الحجز الذي يبعد نصف ساعة عن المطعم. . . The service is a great , Food is the delicious , price is very  reasonable I highly recommend it, and i will comeback again for sure.
Decent price , great food , friendly management and service . Definitely go back again .
Great Persian food. I loved the Dizi. You don't see that dish often in Persian restaurants in US. Definitely recommend you to try their Dizi.
Love it

Great food and costumer service. After more than a decade being away from the homeland, I got to eat Dizi! It was perfect. Masoud, the owner, invited us to have Persian Ice Cream with Saffron, and we found out later that it was on the house. Will definitely come back and recommend it to anyone. Thank you!
Great food, great service.
You must get the safron and pistachio ice cream if it's available (it's not on the menu).  Tell them how you want your meat cooked, they didn't ask and over cooked ours

Had reservations for 1830 hours for 10 people, some of us got there early and yet they seated.  They now serve liquor and have a small but good variety of beer.  Just don't ask for any fancy cocktails.  The food was delicious, everyone enjoyed what they ordered.  The staff was very helpful and had great recommendations.  Will definitely be returning.
Had a delicious dinner tonight.   Staff was very attentive and gave great recommendations.   Will definitely be going back!
Great freshly cooked meal! Fast and professional services!
I truly believe that reviews are fake news!
Excellent food and friendly atmosphere.

Great Persian Food, very original style. One of the finest Persian Cuisine in Buck Town, Sundays they serve  'Dizzy' Also known as Abgosht. Abgoosht is an Iranian stew. It is also called Dizi, which refers to the traditional stone crocks it is served in. Some describe it as a "hearty mutton Persian soup thickened with chickpeas.
Nice atmosphere Good quality food Decent prices Nice people It’s worth to enjoy a meal at this place
This place is great. The food is delicious and will go back again. Service was great and it’s a nice cozy spot

Such a wonderful place, such a wonderful people here, I'm from LANSING MICHIGAN and been here for my work. I travel a lot all over but this place it was so wonderful I will remember it for a long time to come. Food is EXCELLENT Oh my goodness. Please treat your self to great food and wonderful service and hospitality. Please try their TEE and BAMIE.( hope I spelled it correctly) Thank you
Ordered delivery. $16 lamb shank had $2 worth of meat. Sent 1 pita with food for 4 people. Won’t order again.
Never again, meat had no seasoning not worth the price
Great place
Tasty food with generous portions. Cozy and warm atmosphere, definitely check it out for some good Persian food!
Certainly the best Koobideh in Chicagoland. Yes I have tried them all - many time. Dizi is Great Too.
We had mast mooosir for appetizer. It was not a good one(2 star). The Soltani and Barg was Ok (3star). I loved the tea.
Good option in the neighborhood
Great food and hospitality. We wanted good Persian food and received it. Great people and restaurant.
My bestfriend took me to Caspian and I really enjoyed it. I had the lamb shank and it was delicious. 😋
Excellent food
Yum, chicken shawarma plate was really tasty.
Their falafel is delicious!
loved it
Fantastic customer service great homemade hummus i love the caspian burger and chicken kabab sandwiches.
Excellent food, people are great
Very friendly staff! Food is delicious and the dinning area is very clean and cozy!
Clean and delicious food
Great food. Good prices
Good food, inviting atmosphere. Nice to finally see a broader range of restaurants in LV.

I LOVE the food!!  Amazing falafel, hummus, salmon, and more!  It is also very clean, inviting, and has a warm and friendly atmosphere.   Great place for a family meal or a personal meeting.  Will be back soon!
Really nice place , friendly owner , and now my to go place. ☺
Shawarma and falafel plates are tastey. Wish I would stayed to eat, placed a to go order. Place looked clean, good service. Good restaurant overall in Little Village, will definitely go again soon.
Very clean and friendly environment. The food is delicious
Please write down if your meat halal or not ?
Warm very friendly good food also clean place atmosphere good will definitely go back

Oh my god where do I start, this place was nice and very clean. The owner helped us decide what's good on the menu and let us try the wonderful hummus before we got it. Good food, good options. Definitely coming back for more.
Second time I come here, it was amazing! And the hummus is on point! Totally recommend it!
The food is excellent. The hummus is terrific. The owner is a friendly and good natured human that makes wonderful hummus.
These guys are nice and shows they care about their service and making the customer happy.  So good to have options in the neighborhood.
they have some of the best Iranian food that I had in Chicago land area. my favorites are combination platter and Homas. I love them.
